items.message:
River levels have risen at the Lugwardine river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall over the weekend.  Consequently, the risk of flooding remains.  We expect flooding to affect Low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop.   
No further rainfall is forecast.  We expect river levels to remain high until Tuesday 15/03/22.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated this afternoon, 14/03/22 by 18:00, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: Flooding is possible throughout today, Sunday 13th March. Heavy rain over the last 24 hours has caused river levels on the Clyst and Culm to remain high, and flooding to low lying land and roads is possible. Heavy showers will continue to develop on Sunday and Monday, and river levels remain sensitive to further rainfall. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. We are constantly monitoring river levels and will update this message on Monday 14th March, or earlier if the situation changes.
